definition: lit. seek but fail to get (idiom); fig. exactly what one’s been looking for
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
(negative prefix)/not/no
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: The kiln man was overjoyed, and sold it to him at once.
sentences.chinese: 窯工正是求之不得，立刻把驢賣給他。

sentences.english: This is a most welcome opportunity.
If there were big fights at junior welterweight, that's where we would be.
sentences.chinese: 如果大賽安排在超輕量級，我們求之不得。

sentences.english: I could not have asked for a better set of colleagues and friends.
sentences.chinese: 我的這些如此優秀的同事和朋友是我求之不得的。

definition: exactly what one wants
to give one's assent/to consent
to refuse would be impolite
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
a fine thing/a wonderful thing
(coll.) to be eager for/to long for/to look forward to
cushy job/pleasant task
gladly/cheerfully
unable to contain one's joy (idiom)
to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
to readily consent
human nature (idiom)/a behavior that is only natural
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
trivial matter/a piece of cake
deference is no substitute for obedience (idiom)/(said to accept sb's request, invitation etc)
pinyin: gong1 jing4 bu4 ru2 cong2 ming4

definition: not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
